evolvepy.evaluator package

Submodules

evolvepy.evaluator.aggregator module

class evolvepy.evaluator.aggregator.FitnessAggregator(evaluator: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator, mode: int = 2, weights: Optional[Union[int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy.generic, Sequence[Union[int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy.generic]], Sequence[Sequence[Any]], numpy.typing._array_like._SupportsArray]] = None)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.EvaluationStage

Aggregates multiple individual scores into a final fitness.

This stage must always be present in the case of evaluations with multiple fitness.

MAX = 0
MEAN = 2
MEDIAN = 3
MIN = 1
MODE_NAMES = ['MAX', 'MIN', 'MEAN', 'MEDIAN']
func: List[Callable] = [<function amax>, <function amin>, <function mean>, <function median>]

evolvepy.evaluator.cache module

class evolvepy.evaluator.cache.FitnessCache(evaluator: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator, n_generation: Optional[int] = None, max_decimals: Optional[int] = None)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.EvaluationStage

Evaluations cache.

It allows recovering the previous evaluation of an already evaluated individual, increasing the performance.

get_individual_representation(individual: numpy.ndarray) → bytes[source]

Generates the byte representation of an individual, considering the precision in decimal places.

Parameters

individual (np.ndarray) – Individual who will have representation generated.

Returns

Generated representation.

Return type

bytes

evolvepy.evaluator.dispatcher module

class evolvepy.evaluator.dispatcher.MultipleEvaluation(evaluator: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator, n_evaluation: int = 1, agregator: Callable[[numpy.ndarray, int], numpy.ndarray] = <function mean>, discard_min=False, discard_max=False)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.EvaluationStage

Evaluates the same individual several times to avoid noise.

evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator module

class evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.EvaluationStage(evaluator: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator, parameters: Optional[Dict[str, object]] = None, dynamic_parameters: Optional[Dict[str, bool]] = None)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator

An evaluation stage. Allows you to modify the behavior of an evaluator.

Can be chained with other stages.

class evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator(n_scores: int = 1, individual_per_call: int = 1, other_parameters: Optional[Dict[str, object]] = None, dynamic_parameters: Optional[Dict[str, bool]] = None)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.configurable.Configurable, abc.ABC

Base evaluator class.

Must be inherited to be used.

property scores: numpy.ndarray

Scores of the last evaluated individuals.

evolvepy.evaluator.function_evaluator module

class evolvepy.evaluator.function_evaluator.FunctionEvaluator(function: Callable[[numpy.ndarray], Union[int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy.generic, Sequence[Union[int, float, complex, str, bytes, numpy.generic]], Sequence[Sequence[Any]], numpy.typing._array_like._SupportsArray]], n_scores: int = 1, mode: int = 2, individual_per_call: int = 1)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator

Evaluates individuals using a simple function.

JIT = 1
JIT_PARALLEL = 3
NJIT = 2
NJIT_PARALLEL = 4
PYTHON = 0
static call(function: Callable, individual_per_call: int, n_scores: int, population: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Call the fitness function in the desired mode.

Static method to enable just-in-time compilation using Numba.

Parameters

  • function (Callable) – Function that will be used to evaluate individuals.

  • individual_per_call (int) – Number of individuals that are evaluated at each function call.

  • n_scores (int) – Number of scores generated for each individual.

  • population (np.ndarray) – Population to be evaluated

Returns

Population fitness

Return type

np.ndarray

evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator module

class evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessEvaluator(fitness_function: Type[evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessFitnessFunction], n_process: Optional[int] = None, timeout: Optional[int] = None, n_scores: int = 1, individual_per_call: int = 1, args: Optional[Dict[str, object]] = None)[source]

Bases: evolvepy.evaluator.evaluator.Evaluator

Evaluates individuals using multiple process.

class evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessFitnessFunction(reset: bool = False)[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

Base class of fitness function to be used to evaluate individuals in parallel with multiple processes.

It must be inherited in a class that will implement the evaluation.

abstract evaluate(individuals: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Implements the evaluation of individuals.

Must be implemented by the inheriting class.

Parameters

population (np.ndarray) – Individuals to be evaluated.

Returns

Individuals fitness.

Return type

np.ndarray

abstract setup() → None[source]

Method that prepares the evaluator to evaluate individuals.

Called before the first evaluation, and before all evaluations if “reset” is true.

Must be implemented by the inheriting class.

evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.evaluate_forever(fitness_function: Type[evolvepy.evaluator.process_evaluator.ProcessFitnessFunction], individuals_queue: multiprocessing.context.BaseContext.Queue, scores_queue: multiprocessing.context.BaseContext.Queue, args: Dict[str, object])[source]

Prepared the cost function to evaluate the individuals, waits for the receipt of individuals and returns the scores.

Parameters

  • fitness_function (Type[ProcessFitnessFunction]) – Class to be used to evaluate individuals.

  • individuals_queue (mp.Queue) – Queue in which individuals who need to be evaluated will arrive.

  • scores_queue (mp.Queue) – Queue in which the generated scores will be placed.

  • args (Dict[str, object]) – Other evaluator class constructor arguments.

Module contents

EvolvePy’s evaluators. Objects used to evaluate individuals.
